name: JW Marriott San Antonio Hill Country Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I took my wife and two boys, 10 and 14 for one night, June 19th-20th. From the moment I walked in I was impressed by just how well they had nailed the resort experience.The service at check in was impressive. The friendly desk person was diligent in finding two rooms that were near each other that we could check in to early. They could only find one room ready, but allowed us to check in to it and bring our luggage. They then said they would call when the other room was ready AND ACTUALLY CALLED MY CELL PHONE WHEN IT WAS READY!!!. The rooms were fantastic, we had one room with a resort view and one looking out over the golf course. Everything was in great shape and very clean. The pool, water slides, and the lazy river were awesome. We are not golfers so I could not speak to the quality of the courses. My wife and I dined in the Cibolo restaurant, and the boys ate together at the sports bar. We all had great meals. I was really impressed how affordable the food was. Cibolo was offering a BBQ buffet( which we did not partake in) for $20/ pp and it looked awesome. We ordered off of the menu and were stuffed. We were sad to go the next morning after enjoying the full service Starbucks near the lobby. I think Marriott has worked out most of the opening kinks and if they maintain this level of service, they will see me back again and again.
reviews.title: Best Marriott Experience Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights into Father's day on Sunday. The place is magnificient. My son and I played golf Friday afternoon (the Canyons course) and we were the only players on the course. It was like having your private golf course. Greens are fast but true, fairways in unbelievable condition. Staff in pro shop and on the course were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cibolo Moon was not so good. Food and service leave a lot to be desired. high Velocity is good, and the best is the Oaks 18 restaurant. Waiters and food great.
reviews.title: This hotel is AWESOME

reviews.text: Water center (Lazy River) was great. Fun place to spend the day. Great Spa.
reviews.title: We need a thesaurus of superlatives

reviews.text: Rooms nice and beds very comfortable. Staff very friendly except for a few front desk types. All in all a great hotel. If you play golf, 2 TPC championship courses open only to members and JW Marriott Hill Country Resort guests. A great playing experience.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; the staff on the other hand....

reviews.text: Hotel extremely large, i.e. expect lots of walking. It is a long walk on a reasonably steep incline from self parking to hotel. If you can afford to pay extra for valet then this is not a problem. Overall resort was "average" qualityfor the price. Though Resort advertises that there are numerous dining places on site, this is not quite true. The food at the restaraunts was overpriced, limited selection and average. We had to order room service on numerous occassions because this was a better option. Also, had to drive 10 miles twice to neighborhood restaraunts since the resort is far from town. Upon check-in they ask you if you want to pay resort fee of $20. This is supposed to include 2 free drinks each day at the bar. What they do not tell you is only certain drinks (house wine and beer) are part of this deal. The average drink price at the bar is $10. The resort fee is also supposed to include internet access in the rooms. I had trouble accessing the internet and did not use this service during my stay at the resort. Some of the concierge staff had limited information about the resort. Eg. the person we asked did not have accurate information about the daycare center they had on site. The person sent us down to the day care center, however when we got there it was shut for the evening. The house keeping staff skipped cleaning our room on one day. We were in the room, and told them to come 10 minutes later because we were leaving. However, they did not bother to return. On the positive side, the swimming pool and lazy river were outstanding. Thoroughly enjoyed floating on the tubes in the river.The resort is clean and the grounds are beautiful.
reviews.title: Overpriced resort for the value with a great pool and lazy river.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the hotel. Initially we had difficulty finding the hotel but eventually figured out the directions. Unfortunately due to new housing developments off of Hwy 281, traffic was terrible. Avoid Hwy 281 if at all possible and use Bulverde as an alternate route. The hotel is beautiful and large. The staff was attentive and courteous. Our room overlooked the pool area. The room was nice and the bathroom large with a separate shower and bathtub. The room also had a small refrigerator located under the tv. Unfortunately the room is not very soundproof. For whatever reason, the room doors close loudly echoing throughout the hallway and into your room. On one night, one of neighbors decided to entertain a few friends loudly into the night. Unfortunately the walls could not deaden the sound and my wife and I felt like we were in the same room. My wife commented that the hotel was very noisy in the room wings.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was impressive, the lazy river, childrens pool, and water slides were great. My little one couldnt get enough of the pool area.
reviews.title: Not Platinum Friendly...

reviews.text: The food was good, unfortunately when the hotel is near capacity, there tends to be long waits to get a table. This is not good when you have a hungry child.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, beautiful resort

reviews.text: My wife used the spa services and loved it. She is still talking about it.
reviews.title: It was so nice, we've stayed here twice.

reviews.text: You'll be blown away by your first sight of this 1,002 room (biggest in the world) Marriott, which is six separate hotel buildings connected together. Four are connected to the lobby, the other two are extensions. All of the furnishings are custom...every table, chair, lamp, door, floor, wall decoration, etc are heavy duty Texas hill country chic and even the menus in the restaurants are heavy on fat and large portions and short on salads and lighter fare. The quality is very good, however, so don't plan to diet while you're there, just enjoy. The top restaurant is 18 Oaks, specializing in prime beef, with prices to match. Reservations are needed. Eating out is not an option as the property is isolated and downtown is a $50. plus taxi ride away. Area sightseeing is also difficult to do for this reason.
reviews.title: Isolation in Texas Splendor

reviews.text: However, the resort is a destination in itself with TWO TPC golf courses and an amazing water park. A deluxe spa is also on premises. Most guests do not leave the propery, so paying the extra charge for valet parking may not be worth it.
reviews.title: One of the most relaxing vacations I can remember

reviews.text: The rooms are large and bedding and linens are deluxe, as are all the furnishings. Rooms are numbered in four digits, the first digit is, of course, the floor number and the second is the building number. If overlooking the amazing concrete river and water park is to your liking, ask for building number three on the water part side. All rooms have great hill country views.
reviews.title: Slice of Texas heaven: counting the days till I return

reviews.text: Service by the staff is Texas friendly, which sometimes crosses over into too personal, but they try hard to please. Our original bellman told me most of the staff had no hotel experience, since Marriott had a new training program for employees new to the business. He said he would bet I'd never guess that was the case. I replied the only clue of that I had was that he had both our suitcases upside down on the luggage rack and he had forgotten to bring up our hanging items. We both laughed and I tipped him well anyway.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every way.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel/resort with a friend of mine the week before grand opening. The service was very good (admittedly they were still working the last of the bugs out -- everything and everybody was new). The location was great. There are several restaurants there on property, so my friend and I only left the property once during the entire week.
reviews.title: Love the JW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just wanted to say that I stayed there this weekend and I had the worst service I have ever had at a hotel. I was let down in every way possible. The only service we got was when we went to leave from the valet personal. No one greeted you or smiled at you when you left or were walking around. I expected managers and guys of higher authority to always be concerned about you, but instead they all looked like they were body guards. The people around the pool dressed in black wouldnt make eye contact wtih you or smile, was a little scarry. It was not worth the stay. I will not recommend it. I hope I will get a better stay if there is a future trip there. I was not impressed by the food at the restaurants. People did not recommend it to us when we would chat with them at the pool. We figured we would give it a try but we were let down just as well. We did not get the friendliest help nor did we get the quickest. It took a while to get our drinks then we never got napkins nor did we get an extra plate to eat on after we asked several times. I am just very upset with my stay and very let down. The service was terrible. We even heard from the valet personal that he does not even get good reviews. The rooms were not sound proof or comfortable. You could hear everyone slam there doors and talk in the hallway. For 300 a night I would say go stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: not impressed..

reviews.text: This hotel definitely lives up to the saying that everything is bigger in Texas. It's massive. The waterpark is fantastic. The fitness center is top-rate. The sports bar is incredible (almost too big). The only problem is that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. If it were somewhere tropical or on a coast I'd have to rate it top 10 destinations in the country. Unfortunately it's not and its also a half hour from downtown San Antonio and the Riverwalk so there really isn't much else to do.
reviews.title: A Texas Oasis

reviews.text: This hotel is a disgrace.  In all of my years traveling for business and pleasure, I have never had a more terrible experience.  We felt like we were at a Disney park, it was full of screaming kids, and the management did absolutely nothing to adderess behavior.  All of the pools, the park and the spa pool were so hot, that they were not comfortable.  When we spoke with the Concierge about our concerns, they suggested that we travel to this hotel in the off season.  Isn't that unbelievable? Instead of making us feel like we mattered, they suggested that we not visit the property in the popular season.  We will NEVER come back to this hell hole.  If you have at least three screaming kids in tow, and if you only enjoy out-of-control craziness and noise, then this is your kind of place, but, if you prefer peace and a respectful environment, then this is not the place for you.  Prices in the gift shop were exorbitant and ridiculous, the staff was rude and condescending.  Save your money for a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, because you'll spend the same amount of money, but receive much better service! Very, very disappointing experience.  We will never return.
reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!!!

reviews.text: We parked our car and didn't use it again until we had to leave. This hotel is spectacular in every way. It is beautiful, the lazy river and slides are so much fun and the food at all the restaurants was terrific and very reasonable. The breakfast buffet was amazing as was the sport bar. The interior designer of this hotel should be commended, every detail is amazing. We just walked around this beautiful hotel in total awe. The rooms were so comfortable, again every detail thought out so well. I loved having a seperate shower and bath tub, no climbing over a tub to take a shower. It may not be near the city, but who cares, once you arrive at this location there is no need to leave.
reviews.title: Never wanted to leave

reviews.text: This hotel is like a fancy car with no engine. Beautiful property, lots of fancy extras, but absolutely terrible on the basics. Long lines at cash registers while employees 5 feet away are stocking things. Late room service, incorrect room service. Food and beverage was by far the weakest point of the hotel. Every restaurant understaffed, with extremely long waits for food to table, then wrong, etc. In talking to other guests, everyone was having the same experience -- property itself wonderful, all the people working there very incompetent. Westin La Cantera is a much better experience.
reviews.title: Would not come back here - terrible service

aka: Jw Marriott San Antonio Hill Country Resort And Spa
description: The JW Marriott San Antonio Resort and Spa is situated in Texas Hill Country in Cibolo Canyons, where crystal clear streams and towering oak and cedar trees meet the majesty of the hills. The elements of authentic roots, hacienda style, beautiful views and healing waters serve as the inspiration in bringing this magnificent resort to life. The world-class resort features 265,000-square-feet of meeting and event space, the 36 hole TPC San Antonio and the sophisticated Lantana Spa. Resort guests will find culinary delights and boutique shopping awaiting them at every corner.
